p: Antioxidant substances promote improvement in cases of disease caused by coronaviruses, such as apolipoprotein D—a lipocalin that promoted a neuroprotective effect against encephalitis induced by human coronavirus OC43—in mice. This protective effect occurred through the reduction of oxidative stress, cerebral lipid peroxidation, and regulation of inflammation [ 41, 42]. Also, the treatment with antioxidants, such as pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate or N-acetylcysteine, significantly inhibits coronavirus-induced apoptosis [ 43]. Moreover, melatonin promotes downregulation of acute lung oxidative injury due to its anti-inflammatory and antioxidant actions, making it a possible compound in the treatment of COVID-19 [ 44]. Based on these studies, compounds that have antioxidant actions can be helpful in the treatment of infections promoted by coronavirus.
